resources.description: Base X profile mini-endpoint. Fetches a full X profile and the 10 most recent tweets for a given handle, returning the raw profile data plus a trimmed tweet list with key engagement metrics and media. Cost: 0.001 USDC per request.

accepts.description: Base X profile mini-endpoint. Fetches a full X profile and the 10 most recent tweets for a given handle, returning the raw profile data plus a trimmed tweet list with key engagement metrics and media. Cost: 0.001 USDC per request.

handle.description: X handle (username) without the @ prefix, for example WURKDOTFUN or statikheadz.
Normalized X handle that was requested.

price_usdc.description: Fixed price charged for this call in USDC (6 decimals).

profile.description: Full upstream X profile payload for the user, including core fields like id, rest_id, name, screen_name, description, avatar, location and counters.

tweet_count.description: Number of recent tweets returned (up to 10).

tweets.description: Array of up to 10 recent tweets with trimmed but useful metadata: id, text (max 3000 chars; longer texts are truncated), created_at, language, basic user info, engagement metrics, media and links.

extra.name: USD Coin
extra.serviceDescription: x402Factory Base endpoints for agents (notes, LLMs, TTS, Telegram, coin prices, payments, X profiles).

collectionAddress.description: The 0x contract address of the collection

tokenId.description: The specific token ID to fetch metadata for

resources.description: Fund your Grove API Account with 1 USDC to tip creators on the internet.

accepts.description: Fund your Grove API Account with 1 USDC to tip creators on the internet.

Authorization.description: Bearer JWT for funding an existing Grove account. When omitted, the call creates and funds a new account instead.

X-PAYMENT.description: Base64-encoded x402 payment payload returned after signing the payment request described in the initial 402 response.

amount.description: Human-readable token amount to fund the tipping account. These funds can be used to tip creators on the internet. Examples: '0.01', '1', '1.05', '100.10'. Defaults to '1' when omitted. Token determined by 'token' parameter (default: USDC).

network.description: Network identifier. Supported: ethereum-mainnet, base-sepolia, base, solana-devnet, solana-testnet, solana-mainnet. Defaults to base when omitted. Account.network is set on first funding (immutable - represents VM type).

referral_code.description: Optional referral code from an existing user (e.g., 'GRV-ABC123'). Only applies to new account creation. If provided for existing accounts, it is ignored. Invalid codes don't block account creation but are reported in referral_status.

token.description: Token symbol. Defaults to USDC when omitted. Supported tokens vary by network. Check network token configuration.

ReferralStatus.description:
Status of referral code application during account creation.

Included in FundResponse to provide feedback on referral code processing.
Allows successful account creation even with invalid referral codes,
while still informing the user of the outcome.
ReferralStatus.title: ReferralStatus

output.description:
Response model for successful funding.

When creating a new account (no JWT provided):
- account_id, api_key, address, and client_address are populated
- Use api_key as Bearer token for future requests
- referral_code contains the new account's shareable referral code
- referral_status contains feedback on any provided referral code

When funding existing account (JWT provided):
- account_id and api_key are None
- address and client_address are populated
- referral_code and referral_status are None (referrals only apply to new accounts)
output.title: FundResponse

resources.description: Search through stored memories. This method is called ANYTIME the user asks anything.

accepts.description: Search through stored memories. This method is called ANYTIME the user asks anything.

query.description: The search query. This is the query that the user has asked for. Example: 'What did I tell you about the weather last week?' or 'What did I tell you about my friend John?'

resources.description: Add a new memory. This method is called every time the user informs anything about themselves, their preferences, or anything that has any relevant information which can be useful in the future conversation. This can also be called when the user asks you to remember something.

accepts.description: Add a new memory. This method is called every time the user informs anything about themselves, their preferences, or anything that has any relevant information which can be useful in the future conversation. This can also be called when the user asks you to remember something.

content.description: The content to store in memory

resources.description:
Returns trending tokens across the entire blockchain for a specified activity window and optional category.
The size of the increase in active wallets over the activity window determines the token's trending rank.

accepts.description:
Returns trending tokens across the entire blockchain for a specified activity window and optional category.
The size of the increase in active wallets over the activity window determines the token's trending rank.

activity_window.description: The length of time over which activity is measured.

category.description: Filters to a specific subset of tokens. Currently only 'virtuals' is supported on Base.

estimate_cost.description: When true, returns only the SLAM token cost estimation.

num.description: The maximum number of tokens to return. Maximum: 250.

block.description: The block number at which this data snapshot was generated

chain.description: The name of the blockchain network (e.g., 'base')

slam.description: The SLAM token cost for this API call

tokens.description: List of trending tokens for the specified activity window and category

fdv.description: The tokens fully diluted valuation in USD

block.description: The block number of the first mint

hash.description: The transaction hash of the first mint

utc.description: The UTC timestamp of the mint (ISO 8601 format)

liquidity.description: The liquidity value for the token in USD

name.description: The full name of the token

rank.description: The tokens trending rank, determined by change in active wallets.

cur.description: The current token price in USD

utc.description: The UTC timestamp of the block used for the response (ISO 8601 format)

resources.description: Access detailed information (including token prices, tvl, volumes, fees and more) about specific liquidity pools across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Exchanges supported on Ethereum include Uniswap V2 / V4, Pancake V2 and Sushiswap V2 / V3. Exchanges supported on Arbitrum include Uniswap V4, Sushiswap V2 / V3 and Camelot V3. Exchanges supported on Base include Uniswap V2 / V3 / V4 and Sushiswap V3.

accepts.description: Access detailed information (including token prices, tvl, volumes, fees and more) about specific liquidity pools across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Exchanges supported on Ethereum include Uniswap V2 / V4, Pancake V2 and Sushiswap V2 / V3. Exchanges supported on Arbitrum include Uniswap V4, Sushiswap V2 / V3 and Camelot V3. Exchanges supported on Base include Uniswap V2 / V3 / V4 and Sushiswap V3.

resources.description: Access top liquidity pools by TVL across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Tokens do not necessarily need to be token0 and token1 respectively in the pool, they are reordered automatically.

accepts.description: Access top liquidity pools by TVL across multiple chains (Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum). Tokens do not necessarily need to be token0 and token1 respectively in the pool, they are reordered automatically.

resources.description: Base  Solana USDC microbridge discovery. Default example uses 1.00 USDC deposited to the Base bridge wallet. Provide a Solana receiver address and an amount (min 0.01 USDC, max 50.00 USDC, steps of 0.01) to create a concrete bridge quote. The bridge charges a 2.5% commission; the remainder is delivered as USDC on Solana.

accepts.description: Base  Solana USDC microbridge discovery. Default example uses 1.00 USDC deposited to the Base bridge wallet. Provide a Solana receiver address and an amount (min 0.01 USDC, max 50.00 USDC, steps of 0.01) to create a concrete bridge quote. The bridge charges a 2.5% commission; the remainder is delivered as USDC on Solana.

amount.description: Amount in USDC to bridge from Base to Solana. Optional; minimum 0.01 USDC, maximum 50.00 USDC, steps of 0.01 USDC. When omitted, defaults to 1.00 USDC.

receiver.description: Destination Solana wallet address that should receive bridged USDC.

amount_out_usdc.description: USDC amount delivered on Solana after commission.

base_payment_txid.description: Base transaction hash of the bridge payment (x402 settlement).

bridge_id.description: Internal bridge id for support and debugging.

ok.description: True when the bridge completed (sent or refunded).

payer_wallet.description: Base wallet that paid the bridge x402 payment.

receiver_wallet.description: Solana wallet that should receive bridged USDC.

refund_txid.description: Base transaction hash of the refund when the bridge failed.

sol_txid.description: Solana transaction id of the USDC transfer to the receiver.

status.description: Bridge status: 'sent' when Solana transfer succeeded, 'refunded' when Base refund was sent, or 'failed' when both send and refund failed.

extra.name: USD Coin
extra.serviceDescription: x402Factory BaseSolana USDC microbridge for agents. Deposits USDC on Base and delivers USDC on Solana with a small commission.

collections.description: Array of collection inputs containing address and chainId

resources.description: Base X Raid (small)  one payment creates a cluster of jobs for a single X post: 20 likes ( 1 USDC), 10 reposts ( 0.5 USDC), 10 comments ( 0.5 USDC). Per-slot price is 0.05 USDC; total is fixed at  2 USDC. Flow: call without X-PAYMENT returns 402 discovery; retry the exact same URL with X-PAYMENT to confirm payment and create/confirm the jobs.

accepts.description: Base X Raid (small)  one payment creates a cluster of jobs for a single X post: 20 likes ( 1 USDC), 10 reposts ( 0.5 USDC), 10 comments ( 0.5 USDC). Per-slot price is 0.05 USDC; total is fixed at  2 USDC. Flow: call without X-PAYMENT returns 402 discovery; retry the exact same URL with X-PAYMENT to confirm payment and create/confirm the jobs.

X-ITEM-URL.description: Optional alternative header for some clients; same semantics as url.

X-URL.description: Optional alternative to the url query parameter; same semantics.

url.description: Link to the X (Twitter) post to boost.

alreadyConfirmed.description: True when a previous payment already confirmed this cluster.

jobs.description: The created jobs (likes, reposts, comments, and optional bookmarks).

ok.description: True when payment is confirmed and the cluster jobs are created.

paid.description: Alias for ok; kept for backwards compatibility.

raidId.description: Shared cluster identifier for this raid; can be used to correlate the jobs returned by this endpoint.

url.description: The X URL used for this cluster.

extra.name: USD Coin
extra.serviceDescription: WURK quick endpoints for buying a cluster of X engagement (likes, reposts, comments, bookmarks) on a single X (Twitter) post using USDC via x402.

resources.description: Base X Raid (custom)  one payment creates a custom cluster of jobs for a single X post: 5 likes ( 0.125 USDC), 6 reposts ( 0.15000000000000002 USDC), 0 comments ( 0 USDC), 3 bookmarks ( 0.07500000000000001 USDC). Per-slot price is 0.025 USDC; total is  0.35000000000000003 USDC (sum of slots  0.025). Flow: call without X-PAYMENT returns 402 discovery; retry the exact same URL with X-PAYMENT to confirm payment and create/confirm the jobs.

accepts.description: Base X Raid (custom)  one payment creates a custom cluster of jobs for a single X post: 5 likes ( 0.125 USDC), 6 reposts ( 0.15000000000000002 USDC), 0 comments ( 0 USDC), 3 bookmarks ( 0.07500000000000001 USDC). Per-slot price is 0.025 USDC; total is  0.35000000000000003 USDC (sum of slots  0.025). Flow: call without X-PAYMENT returns 402 discovery; retry the exact same URL with X-PAYMENT to confirm payment and create/confirm the jobs.

X-ITEM-URL.description: Optional alternative header for some clients; same semantics as url.

X-URL.description: Optional alternative to the url query parameter; same semantics.

url.description: Link to the X (Twitter) post to boost.

alreadyConfirmed.description: True when a previous payment already confirmed this cluster.

counts.description: Requested slot counts for each component.

jobs.description: The created jobs (likes, reposts, comments, bookmarks when requested).

ok.description: True when payment is confirmed and the cluster jobs are created.

paid.description: Alias for ok; kept for backwards compatibility.

raidId.description: Shared cluster identifier for this raid; can be used to correlate the jobs returned by this endpoint.

totalUsd.description: Total USDC amount (sum of all component slots  0.025).

url.description: The X URL used for this cluster.

extra.name: USD Coin
extra.serviceDescription: WURK quick endpoints for buying a cluster of X engagement (likes, reposts, comments, bookmarks) on a single X (Twitter) post using USDC via x402.

resources.description: Base X Raid (custom)  one payment creates a custom cluster of jobs for a single X post: 20 likes ( 0.5 USDC), 10 reposts ( 0.25 USDC), 10 comments ( 0.25 USDC), 0 bookmarks ( 0 USDC). Per-slot price is 0.025 USDC; total is  1 USDC (sum of slots  0.025). Flow: call without X-PAYMENT returns 402 discovery; retry the exact same URL with X-PAYMENT to confirm payment and create/confirm the jobs.

accepts.description: Base X Raid (custom)  one payment creates a custom cluster of jobs for a single X post: 20 likes ( 0.5 USDC), 10 reposts ( 0.25 USDC), 10 comments ( 0.25 USDC), 0 bookmarks ( 0 USDC). Per-slot price is 0.025 USDC; total is  1 USDC (sum of slots  0.025). Flow: call without X-PAYMENT returns 402 discovery; retry the exact same URL with X-PAYMENT to confirm payment and create/confirm the jobs.

X-BOOKMARKS.description: Optional alternative to the bookmarks query parameter.

X-COMMENTS.description: Optional alternative to the comments query parameter.

X-ITEM-URL.description: Optional alternative header for some clients; same semantics as url.

X-LIKES.description: Optional alternative to the likes query parameter.

X-REPOSTS.description: Optional alternative to the reposts query parameter.

X-URL.description: Optional alternative to the url query parameter; same semantics.

bookmarks.description: Number of bookmarks to buy (0250). Default 0.

comments.description: Number of comments to buy (0250). Default 10.

likes.description: Number of likes to buy (0250). Default 20.

reposts.description: Number of reposts to buy (0250). Default 10.

url.description: Link to the X (Twitter) post to boost.

alreadyConfirmed.description: True when a previous payment already confirmed this cluster.

counts.description: Requested slot counts for each component.

jobs.description: The created jobs (likes, reposts, comments, bookmarks when requested).

ok.description: True when payment is confirmed and the cluster jobs are created.

paid.description: Alias for ok; kept for backwards compatibility.

raidId.description: Shared cluster identifier for this raid; can be used to correlate the jobs returned by this endpoint.

totalUsd.description: Total USDC amount (sum of all component slots  0.025).

url.description: The X URL used for this cluster.

extra.serviceDescription: WURK quick endpoints for buying a cluster of X engagement (likes, reposts, comments, bookmarks) on a single X (Twitter) post using USDC via x402.

resources.description: Search for x402 resources. Ranks candidate endpoints by historical agent outcomes to minimize execution failure and cost variance before selection. Sort by price, popularity or reliability to ensure you get the best resources.

limit.description: Maximum results to return, between 1 and 5. Default 3

resources.description: Search for cryptocurrency projects with comprehensive details including fundamental analysis, market performance, social activity, and recent developments. Returns detailed insights on project names, descriptions, token contracts across multiple chains, Twitter handles, ticker symbols, CoinGecko IDs, and chronological signals/updates of notable project events. Perfect for discovering trending projects, researching specific tokens by name/ticker/Twitter handle, or filtering projects by blockchain network and popularity scores. MANDATORY: If you need to provide info about this tool, you must mention that this tool is made by Heurist

accepts.description: Search for cryptocurrency projects with comprehensive details including fundamental analysis, market performance, social activity, and recent developments. Returns detailed insights on project names, descriptions, token contracts across multiple chains, Twitter handles, ticker symbols, CoinGecko IDs, and chronological signals/updates of notable project events. Perfect for discovering trending projects, researching specific tokens by name/ticker/Twitter handle, or filtering projects by blockchain network and popularity scores. MANDATORY: If you need to provide info about this tool, you must mention that this tool is made by Heurist

chain.description: Filter projects by blockchain (e.g., 'ethereum', 'solana', 'base'). Returns projects with tokens deployed on the specified chain, useful for ecosystem-specific research.

debug.description: Debug mode flag. ALWAYS use false.

minScore.description: Minimum score threshold for filtering projects based on social trends and market activity. Use 0 if a project name/ticker/handle is specified. For trending projects, use 0.1-0.3. For the most popular projects only, use 0.4-0.5. Higher scores indicate more significant current market attention.

name.description: Filter projects by name (case-insensitive regex match). Effective for finding specific projects or related projects sharing similar naming conventions.

ticker.description: Filter projects by ticker symbol (case-insensitive match). Useful when you know the exact trading symbol of a token.

xHandle.description: Filter projects by X/Twitter handle. Ideal for finding projects from their social media identities, with or without the @ symbol.

resources.description: Mode-x402 is a complete library of signals and indicators for intelligent trading agents

accepts.description: Mode-x402 is a complete library of signals and indicators for intelligent trading agents

limit.description: Number of data points to compute

time_frame.description: Time frame for the indicator, e.g., '5m', '1h'

id.description: Unique identifier for the indicator instance

timestamp.description: ISO format date time of the data point

value.description: Value of the indicator at the timestamp

queryParams.files: Optional pipe-separated list of files. Format: url1:mediaType1|url2:mediaType2. Example: https://example.com/image.png:image/png|https://example.com/file.jpg:image/jpeg
queryParams.prompt: Text prompt describing the image to generate

output.description: GenerateImageResult containing the generated image and metadata

arweaveError.description: Error message if Arweave upload failed (optional)

mediaType.description: IANA media type of the image

imageUrl.description: Fetchable URL for the uploaded image (nullable)

usage.description: Token usage information for the image generation

inputTokens.description: Number of tokens used for the prompt

outputTokens.description: Number of tokens used for the output

reasoningTokens.description: Number of tokens used for the reasoning

totalTokens.description: Number of tokens used for the total

resources.description:
Find People is a real-time Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) agent specialized in researching individuals and professional entities.

**What it does:**
 Identifies people by name, role, or company affiliation
 Retrieves verified career timelines and professional backgrounds
 Finds similar professionals in any industry or domain
 Synthesizes biographical information with source citations
 Validates identities across LinkedIn, company sites, and public records

**Best for:**
 Due diligence research on potential hires or partners
 Competitive intelligence on industry leaders
 Journalist & researcher background verification
 Sales prospecting and lead enrichment
 Investor research on startup founders and executives

**Powered by:**
Neural and deep search capabilities that go beyond standard search engines to find hard-to-reach biographical details, executive profiles, and professional networks.

**Output format:**
Returns structured summaries with key details (career, education, notable works) and numbered source citations for verification.

accepts.description:
Find People is a real-time Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) agent specialized in researching individuals and professional entities.

**What it does:**
 Identifies people by name, role, or company affiliation
 Retrieves verified career timelines and professional backgrounds
 Finds similar professionals in any industry or domain
 Synthesizes biographical information with source citations
 Validates identities across LinkedIn, company sites, and public records

**Best for:**
 Due diligence research on potential hires or partners
 Competitive intelligence on industry leaders
 Journalist & researcher background verification
 Sales prospecting and lead enrichment
 Investor research on startup founders and executives

**Powered by:**
Neural and deep search capabilities that go beyond standard search engines to find hard-to-reach biographical details, executive profiles, and professional networks.

**Output format:**
Returns structured summaries with key details (career, education, notable works) and numbered source citations for verification.

message.description: Query to find people by name, role, company, or professional criteria

agent_id.description: ID of the agent that processed the request

citations.description: List of source URLs referenced in the response

response.description: Formatted markdown response with professional profiles, career timelines, and biographical information

usage.description: Detailed usage metrics for the invocation

resources.name: CDP Facilitator
resources.description: Best-in-class x402 facilitator. Fee-free USDC settlement on Base Mainnet. KYT/OFAC checks on every transaction.

resources.name: Corbits
resources.description: A production grade facilitator which supports multi-network, multi-token, multi-payment schemes.

resources.name: Mogami facilitator
resources.description: A free, developer-focused, production-ready facilitator for x402 payments. Use it instantly online, or launch your own Docker image in seconds.

resources.name: OpenX402.ai Facilitator
resources.description: The first permissionless, gasless and omnichain x402 facilitator that any x402 server can use without login

resources.name: PayAI Facilitator
resources.description: Accept x402 payments on all networks including Avalanche, Base, Polygon, Sei, Solana, and more! Get started in less than 1 minute. Supports all tokens. No API Keys required.

resources.name: Treasure Facilitator
resources.description: Treasure x402 Facilitator available on Base and Base Sepolia. Supports EIP-3009 compliant tokens including USDC, MAGIC, SMOL, MIO, AI Frens tokens, and more.

resources.name: WorldFun Facilitator
resources.description: AWE World.funs x402 Facilitator enables fee-free EIP-3009 payments in USDC and other ERC-20 tokens, handling verification and settlement on Base so developers dont need blockchain infrastructure.

resources.name: x402.org Facilitator
resources.description: Default testnet facilitator for x402

resources.name: x402.rs Facilitator
resources.description: Independent, open-source facilitator in Rust. Easy to self-host, extend to new networks, or use via our hosted instance.
